document_title: Ventricular tachycardia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
During ventricular tachycardia, the heart often beats at a very fast frequency and the efficiency of each beat is very low compared to normal sinus rhythm, thus often not providing enough blood to other organs. Ventricular tachycardia may last only a few seconds. Sustained ventricular tachycardia is often a dangerous, life-threatening condition. (2)
According to MSc.BS.CKI Vu Xuan Quang, symptoms of ventricular tachycardia include:
Dizzy;; Lightheadedness;; Chest pain;; Short of breath;; Heart beating fast;; Palpitations;; Faint;; The heart stops beating.; In some cases, the patient may not experience symptoms of ventricular tachycardia.
Sudden fainting can be a warning sign of dangerous ventricular tachycardia
